text:
Seo Minwoo is my life mentor. He gave up everything for 100% and perfection. Words are not enough to describe how great of a person he is. How lovely, caring and talented he is.



Seo Minwoo, my king... I love you. pic.twitter.com/nKe79E7fAD — ❥Haya 👑서민우👑 (@SexyChanyonce) March 26, 2018

Seo Minwoo gave up is acting career for 100%. Fought Top Media over and over again (f*ck you tm) to keep 100% together. Everything he did he put his absolute everything in.



He openly supported LGBTQ, did vlives often to talk with perfection about their concerns — ❥Haya 👑서민우👑 (@SexyChanyonce) March 26, 2018

"If 100% were a religion, I'd build them a church and dedicate my whole life and soul to them" — ❥Haya 👑서민우👑 (@SexyChanyonce) December 24, 2015

#RainbowbebeSelcaDay (MonbebeSelcaDay) has been Cancelled this Month out of Respect of 100% Seo Minwoo, Monbebe Send our Condolences and Prayers to his Family,Brothers And Fans. #RIPMinwoo ♥️ — Multi.. 🍋 HappyMinoDay (@Dynamicduhoe) March 29, 2018

Guys let's show some respect for Seo Minwoo and not post selca days for a short while. He deserves it, and so does 100% fandom and his family. 💗 — Saz (@kuanlinstea) March 29, 2018

to ALL fandoms,

In respect to 100%‘s Seo Minwoo

who just passed away. Their fandom, Perfection are asking for a favor that all fandoms should not post a selca this upcoming April. Please RT to spread! Thank you. — 𝐦𝐢𝐜𝐤𝐞𝐲 (@lauvIies) March 29, 2018

To the South Korean government: Let #Jonghyun be the light in death that he was in life.



Recognize that suicide is an epidemic in South Korea and takes strides to ending the negative stigmas around mental health and to combat this issue.



Don’t let Jonghyun be another statistic — Xavier (@dksoulstice) December 18, 2017

Nine said on the last interview Jonghyun once told her that she brings comfort to him. She noticed his condition got worse after blue night and when he gave her the letter she told his family right away, tried to save him, to prevent the worst from happening... — 5HINee Poet | Artist (@SHlNeePlNee) March 29, 2018

I really believe everyone around him knew about his condition and tried their best to help him. that’s why it hurts so much, that even though he got help he still wanted to leave — 5HINee Poet | Artist (@SHlNeePlNee) March 29, 2018

‘Baby Kara’ member Ahn So-jin dead in apparent suicide. She was only 22 years old. #Kpop. http://t.co/7BZcxTcoV5 pic.twitter.com/43yjbCWrcc — Kore Asian Media (@koreasianmedia) February 26, 2015

Mr. Cha Eunwoo

Happy birthday to our sweet and sparkling fluff. AROHA are so lucky to have you. Stay happy and healthy. 💜💜💜#HAPPY_CHAEUNWOO_DAY pic.twitter.com/VY6Gszmw7K — #happychaeunwooday (@ashlyn_akiko) March 29, 2018

Glut - Artists - Groups - Days - Star

(Excerpt) Read more at: E! Online

Wake Up To Breaking News! SUBMIT

But Jonghyun's death was hardly the first time the punishing pace of the K-pop machine had come under fire.In addition to being expected to tour and crank out albums, sometimes in multiple languages (SHINee had also recorded in Japanese), the artists often appear on a never-ending stream of competition TV series in addition to doing talk shows, photo shoots and public appearances to keep the fans both sated and hungry for more.But despite the seeming glut of artists and groups to remember (there are so many selca days), truly breaking through as a star remains an elusive concept—and standing out in South Korea's youth-obsessed culture can feel like an insurmountable challenge.And then there's the appearance factor. "If a girl has a bad face and a good body, the problem can be fixed with plastic surgery," Kim Min-seok, a former...
title: Inside the Sadness Plaguing K-Pop

og.title: Inside the Sadness Plaguing K-Pop
og.description: Seo Minwoo is my life mentor. He gave up everything for 100% and perfection. Words are not enough to describe how great of a person he is.
